meanings.sent1: Her manipulativeness was evident in the way she always got what she wanted.
meanings.sent2: I could see his manipulativeness when he tried to twist the truth to his advantage.
meanings.sent3: His manipulativeness in convincing everyone to wear silly hats made us all laugh.
meanings.sent4: The manipulativeness of the situation was like a tangled web of lies.
meanings.sent5: The manipulativeness of the character made him unforgettable in the story.

meanings.definition: The act of manipulating or controlling others through deceit or cunning tactics.
meanings.sent1: She used her manipulativeness to influence the outcome of the game.
meanings.sent2: His manipulativeness was revealed when his plan to deceive others failed.
meanings.sent3: The magician's manipulativeness in making the rabbit disappear amazed the audience.
meanings.sent4: The manipulativeness of the spy's tactics was like a puzzle waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent5: The manipulativeness of the villain's actions kept the audience on the edge of their seats.
